comment: I am writing this a few semesters after I took his class. I liked the class a lot, and in fact I work in his department now and help tutor his class. During lectures he routinely will explain why the code works on a deeper level. He makes a lot of jokes too during lecture which can keep it engaging during the slower topics.
Good teacher

Professor Sullivan was a very good teacher. He was very knowledgeable about programming. Grade was made up of 3 exams (lockdown browser) and quizzes. He did a great job preparing the class for the exams. 100% would take him again.
Amazing professor. Lectures were amazing and prof always answered questions. 1322 lecture was graded by 3 exams and weekly quizzes. Quizzes were open note/internet.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He is a great lecturer. Going to his office hours is very useful if you're at all struggling with a concept or assignment. He's very caring. BUT he will not budge on the course policy of no make-up quizzes unless you are literally in a hospital for the entire week covering a topic, but that's why there's a policy to drop the lowest grade. Take him.

The class is only challenging because of the content and lack of grades outside of the quiz and exam. The professor does a good job of explaining everything even if I couldn't really understand all of it, and the class itself wasn't difficult.

I took CS1322 as an online course and all the lectures were provided as videos. They're available on YouTube so I could go back and find them pretty easily if I needed. In the videos, he explains everything pretty thoroughly and gives good examples.
Absolutely amazing professor!!! I love him so much I wish I could take him for every CS class here
Amazing teacher, his videos are super helpful and you can tell he cares about our education.

Personally, I didn't go to the lectures as I was already experienced in programming & it was on a separate campus, however, if this topic may be hard for you definitely go to the lecture! He's good-spirited and knowledgable on the topics.

Literally the best professor I have ever had. He is hilarious and easy to talk to and will do anything to ensure that you understand the content of his class. I wish all teachers had the passion that he has with his class. quizzes are easy and tests are easy if you understand the quizzes.
GOAT professor of KSU, take him for any class.

Hands down this professor produces some of the best content I have seen in 4 years of classes at KSU.    His videos are detailed, succinct, soothing, and focus on the most important things about Java/C#.  They are occasionally funny, too.   CSE 1322/L is not an easy class, but Professor Sullivan shows how online learning can be done right.

Professor Sullivan is simply one of the best, if not the best lecturer I have seen. He demonstrates an incredible level of knowledge and wit, which makes class engaging and fascinating. Although attendance is not mandatory, you will miss out on lots of important information if you don't show up.

Best professor yet. Very engaging with the class, and he creates a lot of live examples of coding in class so you can really understand what's going on. Fire away with any questions you've got, he loves answering 'em. Quick and witty, he gets down to the point of things without wasting any time. Absolutely take him if there's space in his class.

Enda Sullivan is simply the best professor at KSU, he is the sole reason that I chose to pursue my major in Software Engineering. His lectures are the first ever that I've ever been upset about missing

Okay, I'm going to be honest. I didn't have Sullivan...BUT I did have a different professor that simply used all his online lectures. His lectures are FANTASTIC. I've never absorbed programming concepts easier and in a more efficient way! If you have the chance to take him, DO IT! Or if you have another professor...USE HIS LECTURES!
The best prof I have ever taken. Please take his class!!

Great teacher and genuinely nice, super helpful office hours and his lectures are genuinely entertaining. The tests are easy, utilize the resources & weekly quizzes (super easy). Took him for 1321 & 1322 and passed the lectures and labs with A's with no prior coding experience. Always available for feedback on coursework & code & very detailed.

Enda Sullivan is a great professor! His lecture PowerPoints are always available online and he is more than happy to answer any questions. Attendance is not mandatory, though the exams are taken on Lockdown Browser.

The best professor here!! Amazing lectures, great examples, and explains everything so well. Very glad I took his 1322 course, he made tough topics easy to digest and understand. Real learning was done here!

probably the best professor at KSU, 8 easy quizzes with lowest grade dropped, the test arent hard because he does an hour long review, the test questions come from this review and previous quizzes, easy to access and cares about his students success, whoever rated him a 1 just didn't try hard and procrastinated lol
If you have the option to take this professor take him. Very knowledgeable and very good at teaching the concepts you need to know. Nice guy, down to earth and willing to help if you need it.

One word to describe Professor Sullivan: GREAT. The class is very easy with weekly quizzes that are open notes, one of which is dropped, and the questions from those quizzes are the same questions that will be on the tests. 1322L is also relatively straightforward with a little more work with programming; however, one assignment & lab are dropped.
Amazing professor and literal genius. Instruction is crystal clear. My favorite thing about him is his British accent idk why lol.
Drops lowest quiz at the end of the class. Love his lectures honestly my favorite teacher at KSU.

Professor Sullivan is probably the best CS professor at KSU. He responds to emails really quickly and although he wasn't my professor for my lab section, he helped me all the time thru email. The quiz and exams are by the department so not written by him but he does teach the class very well so it is so hard not to get an A in the class. TAKE HIM!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The class I took was actually CSE 1300 (intro to comp sci), but I highly!! recommend taking him. His lectures are interesting and he makes the material easily digestible even though I'm someone with zero experience in coding. He's also funny and even though it was an in-person class, video lectures are posted in case you can't attend.
This professor know what he's taking about for intro to computer science. Taking him is a no brainer.

Extremely good professor. Keeps the lectures interesting and also relates what we learn to the outside world. Will tell you if something is considered stupid or unnecessary. Talks about interviews and what you can expect to see in them. Seriously one of the best professors I've ever had.
he's amazing! very kind and patient too

One of the most enjoyable instructors I have ever had. You don't have to go to any of the lectures, but I would recommend it. All of the grades are tests and quizzes, but that's just how the course works. Has very helpful in-class review prior to the exam and study guides. Complete everything with a bit of effort behind it and you'll get an A

Professor Sullivan was a great teacher for this course. His lectures are interesting and his explanations on topics are very good. He does a good job trying to engage the class and will always try to help you if needed.

Professor Sullivan is a great lecturer and an amazing asset for KSU CCSE. I came into the class already knowing how to program, but I still learned a lot since he goes in depth into topics that other professors might not.

From class mammls to toString @Overrides to popping off the activation stack in recursion, the effort he puts into his lectures is tremendous and will definitely keep you invested for sure. He undoubtedly cares about his students and can help you suceed.

Enda Sullivan is the best computer science professor at the university. His lectures cover all of the test material and are surprisingly entertaining. Plus, if you ever have questions, he always does an incredible job answering them with clarity and detail. Do yourself a favor and take his class, you can't get a better professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Very nice, good at answering questions. Explains material clearly. Has resources on the class page to help students outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great teacher. Knows what he is talking about.

He. Is. Amazing. Absolutely take this guy if you can. Programming isnt meant to be easy but he made it so. Always answers questions, is always available when he says he is, doesn't make you feel stupid, lectures can be long but he makes them fun and engaging. Tests are exactly what he says they are literally. Quiz on d2l everyweek (no lockdown).YES
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class with this teacher 2 times. The second time it was in another class with another prof. and at last minute they changed to him. what it explains does not appear in the exams. Is a difficult class. Lots of jobs and assignments. You hardly have time to do homework and study. If you request a system regrade he tells you isn't needed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Sullivan records a lot of lectures. Hours and hours and hours of lectures. The good news is that he is a GREAT lecturer! All you really need to do well in the class is watch his lecture videos and do the lab exercises from the associated lab class. If you can't take him, subscribe to his YouTube channel.

As someone with ADHD who doesnt do well in online classes Endas class was perfect for me. Everything is planned out in D2L, if something changes from the norm he emails you to let you know whats going on. He has weekly video lectures which can be long at times but his quirky nature makes it bearable, its easy to see that he loves what he does.

Ny far the best professor Kennesaw has to offer for CSE/IT program. Even being an online student, I still got quality education. He takes the time to record lectures and go over each aspect. Even reviews for tests. I love him. Take him please if youre an online learner. To me his lectures were engaging. Tests are clear so are quizzes. 10/10!

While I didn't do the best, Edna is an amazing guy. His lectures are funny and engaging and he makes sure everyone gets the content via lectures or his Youtube channel. The CS program at KSU is the real problem with his course but that is not his fault.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Hilarious

comment: He is funny but no one has the balls to laugh in class lol. He explains all topics really well and includes real life examples in his lectures. Class content can't really be judged cuz all the FYE program uses the same materials/tests, but he does a good job reviewing for them- he also makes the tests which is a great bonus ;)

Enda is one of the best professors in the CSE department at KSU. You can tell he deeply cares about his students and wants them to pass the class while also retaining the information that taught. I would definitely take him again!
I truly like this professor. He care a lot for his students. Give great advices about how to succeed his class. Overall he is a good professor and I recommend his class.

One of my favorite professors hands down. My class was online, but I still had a very good understanding of the concepts based on the recorded lectures alone. He breaks everything down and uses multiple examples. He is a little clumsy and likes to make jokes, so the lectures are never boring. Also makes study guides similar to tests. TAKE HIM.

HES AMAZING. I had to retake this class and the difference between this guy and the first professor was NIGHT AND DAY. Enda WANTS you to pass. Programming is time consuming, confusing, difficult > But he's there to help you understand no matter how annoying you are. I'm VERY BAD at coding and still pulled through without too much trouble. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Any other professor would have left me guessing and frustrated on a lot of this course's assignments (and they have). He breaks everything down and explains the material until you understand, he does a lot of test prep, and he uploads all of his lectures so that you can review the material if you forgot something! Take him even if it is a 7am.

He's a super nice guy, good sense of humor, explains programming in a very clear and accessible way. I'd go out of my way to take more classes with him, he has a knack for breaking down complicated topics and making them easy to understand. 10/10.

Realy nice guy. Most times if your struggling you should ad him because he is very accommodating, and will help you without giving the answer. I took Data Structures with him and it was a great semester, he focused on data structures rather than C++ and moved the class to replit because people struggled with getting the IDE to work.
Excellent professor. His lectures are top notch. Usually responded to my emails within 24 hours. His test review lectures are excellent and he takes the time to cover everything for the tests. ;

I wish Dr. Sullivan was in charge of the FYE. He cares about and understands his students. His lectures may feel long sometimes and he knows that. It's because he wants you to learn not only "what" but also "how" and "why." Pay attention to every word he says and be able to write every code he writes in the lectures. You will be fine on the tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Funny, love his YouTube videos.

The FYE program is a mess, but Professor Sullivan was great. His lectures are lengthy, but they go in depth on the topics and are helpful. His exam prep videos are also fantastic. Take his class if you can.

An absolute GEM! Definitely take him. I have struggled with the FYE programming classes but this is the first time that I have felt confident in what I've learned. He creates videos for every lecture and he makes reviews for the tests. He replies quickly to emails and he even answers questions about the lab class instead of sending you elsewhere.

Professor Sullivan makes the living hell that is FYE livable. He's easy to get in contact with and will answer questions. His lectures aren't terrible although long. Watch the review lectures and take the practice test and you should do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Best professor in the world. 50% of your grade is for showing up to class. He has so much knowledge about so many things. Ask him questions and participate in class. 2 papers, 1 presentation with a partner, and that's it.  Get easy A. Helps you out and grading is clear and fair. Take him at all cost.
